content:
# I have successfully gathered 20 iron ore, bringing my inventory to:
# - 5 Coal
# - 10 Stone
# - 20 Iron Ore
# - 1 Iron Plate

# Now that I have iron ore, I can return to the Stone Furnace and smelt it into iron plates to craft the Iron Chest.

# I will move back to the Stone Furnace and check its inventory status.
move_to(furnace_position)  # Move back to the Stone Furnace

# Check the furnace's inventory to see how much coal it has left.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)
print(f"Furnace inventory before smelting: {furnace_inventory}")

# Since the furnace has only 3 coal left, I will insert 5 coal from my inventory to ensure it has enough fuel.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace_entity, quantity=5)

# Now I will insert the 20 iron ore into the furnace to smelt it into iron plates.
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace_entity, quantity=20)

# Wait for the furnace to smelt the iron ore into plates.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    if inspect_inventory(furnace_entity)[Prototype.IronPlate] >= 10:  # Check if we have produced enough plates
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs again.")

# Finally, check the inventory to see the results after smelting the iron ore.
print(f"Inventory after smelting iron ore: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")
